Description: A hollow terracotta head of Isis, broken from a figure. Her hair is divided in the centre by a pendent element, and falls in Isis-locks beside her neck. She wears a bound wreath surmounted by a horned crown with disc and feathers. The back is plain. The break at the bottom has been smoothed and a small hole bored in the back in modern times. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt. Traces of a dull red fired-on slip.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Giovanni d’Athanasi. Ptolemaic, third century bc. Comparanda: Close: Greifenhagen 1933: col. 426, fig. 5, dated early Hellenistic. Near: Fischer 1994: no. 883, dated end of second century ad = Vogt 1924: pl. viii:5. Bibliog. d’Athanasi 1837: lot 944.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3004)
